intro: Schefflera japurensis, commonly known as the Japurana umbrella plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araliaceae. Native to the Amazon rainforest in Brazil, it is characterized by its distinctive, umbrella-like arrangement of leaves. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are palmately compound, with multiple leaflets radiating from a central point. Schefflera japurensis produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by red berries, making it a visually striking plant in its natural habitat.
